meanings.definition: To spread over or occupy in a large, destructive manner.
meanings.sent1: The weeds overran the garden, choking out all the flowers.
meanings.sent2: The flood overran the banks of the river, causing widespread damage.
meanings.sent3: The ants overran the picnic, leaving no food untouched.
meanings.sent4: The virus overran the computer system, corrupting all the files.
meanings.sent5: The invaders overran the castle, capturing it swiftly.

meanings.definition: To exceed or surpass in running.
meanings.sent1: The cheetah overran the gazelle, catching it easily.
meanings.sent2: The athlete overran the competition, winning the race.
meanings.sent3: The kids overran the playground, playing tag with great speed.
meanings.sent4: The car overran the speed limit, getting a ticket from the police.
meanings.sent5: The horse overran the other horses, reaching the finish line first.

meanings.sent1: The river overran its banks, flooding the nearby fields.
meanings.sent2: The marathon runner overran the finish line, exhausted but victorious.
meanings.sent3: The dog overran the yard, chasing after a squirrel.
meanings.sent4: The car overran the stop sign, narrowly avoiding a collision.
meanings.sent5: The children overran the playground, laughing and playing together.
